alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued July 18 at 4:55AM HST until July 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL TONIGHT FOR MAUI COUNTY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TONIGHT FOR THE HALEAKALA SUMMIT... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR MAUI COUNTY ... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE HALEAKALA SUMMIT ... .Strengthening winds will develop today in advance of Tropical Storm Calvin. These winds may become damaging later this evening through Wednesday afternoon as Calvin passes just south of the islands in Maui County. ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, east winds 25 to 45 mph with gusts around 50 mph expected. For the High Wind Watch, east winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts over 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Haleakala Summit. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 6 PM HST this evening. For the High Wind Watch, from this evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Take precautions now to protect property. Tie down loose objects or move them to a sheltered location.
